mancala

Class SocketManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • mancala.SocketManager

  • public class SocketManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class managing the output and input of the socket to communicate with the server.
    Author:
    Julien MONTEIL, Florian RICHARD

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      SocketManager(java.net.Socket socket)
      SocketManager constructor, instantiates the proper objects to send and receive requests.

      • SocketManager

        public SocketManager(java.net.Socket socket)
        SocketManager constructor, instantiates the proper objects to send and receive requests.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • listen

        public ServerOutputController listen()
        Method which listens the server output. Handle the output with ServerOutputController class
        Returns:
        response, the request received from the server which has been converted to an object with accessible properties.
        See Also:
        ServerOutputController

      • sendUsername

        public void sendUsername(java.lang.String username)
        Send a request to the server containing the username of the player.
        Parameters:
        username - Player's username

      • sendMove

        public void sendMove(java.lang.String index)
        Send a request to the server containing the index of the hole which the move comes from.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the hole whose seeds need to be moved.

      • sendConfirm

        public void sendConfirm(java.lang.String target)
        Send a request to the server confirming or not the previous move done.
        Parameters:
        target - confirm or cancel depending on the action.

      • sendContinue

        public void sendContinue()
        Send a request to the server to continue to the next round

      • sendNewGame

        public void sendNewGame()
        Send a request to the server to start a new game. Only one player needs to do it.

      • sendSurrend

        public void sendSurrend()
        Send a request to the server to surrender a round. Can only be done on player's turn.

      • sendReset

        public void sendReset()
        Send a request to the server to reset the game. Done after the end of a game.

      • sendDifficulty

        public void sendDifficulty(java.lang.String difficulty)
        Send a request to the server containing the difficulty mode chosen for the incoming game.
        Parameters:
        difficulty - whether easy or normal

      • sendLoad

        public void sendLoad(java.lang.String board)
        Send a request to the server to load a particular loaded board. Following the load action.
        Parameters:
        board - The board loaded from the file chooser.
